history.content:
If you want to do a single class and get the most breadth out of the class, I would heavily recommend 162 because it gives a wide sampling of different topics that will come up in 161, 168, and 186. However, the projects are massive (4 people) and the autograder (when I took it) is not available locally.

Alternatively, if you want to have two classes meeting all the criteria, cs168 and 186 are both very fundamental classes that will be beneficial in industry which both have websites with all of this necessary information (cs168.io and http://www.cs186berkeley.net/) . Sadly, most classes do not have public webcasted lectures anymore given issues that arose with youtube so that is not possible (unless you have a friend who is in the class that can give you the direct links but cs164 and cs168 are generally not webcasted). 

-------------------------------------

I think that while you're at Berkeley (till you have your CalNet login), you can choose to download the webcasts of the classes which you'd like to take (and are available) and save it on your local machine.

I can't speak for the other classes but CS186 has almost all resources accessible to everyone. For the projects, 60% of the tests are local and you can definitely choose to do the course independently if you can download the lectures beforehand.

If you want to do a single class and get the most breadth out of the class, I would heavily recommend 162 because it gives a wide sampling of different topics that will come up in 161, 168, and 186. However, the projects are massive (4 people) and the autograder (when I took it) is not available locally.

Alternatively, if you want to have two classes meeting all the criteria, cs168 and 186 are both very fundamental classes that will be beneficial in industry which both have websites with all of this necessary information (cs168.io and http://www.cs186berkeley.net/) . Sadly, most classes do not have public webcasted lectures anymore given issues that arose with youtube so that is not possible (unless you have a friend who is in the class that can give you the direct links but cs164 and cs168 are generally not webcasted). 

-------------------------------------

I can't speak for the other classes but CS186 has almost all resources accessible to everyone. For the projects, 60% of the tests are local and you can definitely choose to do the course independently if you can download the lectures beforehand.

Alternatively, if you want to have two classes meeting all the criteria, cs168 and 186 are both very fundamental classes that will be beneficial in industry which both have websites with all of this necessary information (cs168.io and http://www.cs186berkeley.net/) . Sadly, most classes do not have public webcasted lectures anymore given issues that arose with youtube so that is not possible (unless you have a friend who is in the class that can give you the direct links but cs164 and cs168 are generally not webcasted).

children.subject: They are viewable at webcast.berkeley.edu with a Berkeley account. Downloading those restricted videos though, it's harder.
Where would I be able to download the webcasts?

history.content:
Hello Everyone,

I am interested in learning CS 161, 162, 164, 168 and 186 but unfortunately, my time at Berkeley has come to an end :( .

I am planning to self study one of the course from above and was wondering if anyone can recommend me a class that has the features:

1. access to all lectures, discussions, hw, and projects

2. some local autograding for hw and projects

3. projects that can be completed by 1 person.

I'm also open to outside resource but I'm a huge fan of classes taught here.

Go bears!
history.subject: Need recommendations
